reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great training tool for runners.
reviews.author: MannyB
reviews.content: I’ve owned Garmins before and find the ability to objectively gauge and plan your training is a powerful tool. This watch takes it to the next level compared to my old ones. You get essentially the Forerunner 265 here minus the Amoled screen and the training readiness metric. Here’s a hint, look at your body battery and recovery metric and you have pretty much training readiness nailed down. The biometric sensors of the 255 and 265 are the same.Activity tracking is light years beyond Fitbit and also stock Apple Watched. Hell, having 5 buttons blows any Apple Watch out of the water for running. You can just hit an activity and go, or take a recommended workout. You can also make your own routines and upload to to the watch. I had some workouts from when I last owned a Garmin that I designed 10 years ago, and was able to upload and run them. I principally use it for running and strength training. For running I can’t find any faults for me. For strength training my complaint is the list of strength exercises is missing common exercises, like any read deltoid exercises…. It has an exhaustive list of odd ones too. Worst of all, you can’t make new ones. You can just use an existing one that is close enough and make a note that exercise X is really the one you did…. The watch also does a good job tracking indoor runs and both indoor and outdoor walks. It is pretty accurate in automatically detecting activities like impromptu walks, as well. The MIPs screen is amazing outdoors and way better at night when you would don’t want to blast your face looking at the time. In mixed-level indoor lighting, it lacks compared to AMOLED. It doesn’t have the pretty colors nor the contrast indoors, but I like a more serious looking watch anyway and find AMOLED to look like a game. The battery life is amazing. To get this sort of life on the 265 you have to let face go dark when inactive and use gestures to wake it. Not a big deal, but nice to be able to see the watch with a side glimpse without having to raise hand all the time.Customization is great. I downloaded a watch face that allows me to put all the metrics I need and have the time highly visible. Data screens are also very customizable. I have downloaded a custom data screen for running and for strength training to supplement the default screens.This isn’t a Pixel watch or an Apple Watch. As a smart watch it has limited ability and that’s fine. It reliably shows notifications. If you have your phone with you, you can initiate contact with an emergency contact. For example, you can send a message to come get picked up. If you have a compatible bank or credit card, you can use Garmin pay. I do find my financial institutions don’t currently support it, though.The music functionality is flawless. I use it with Spotify and a pair of JBL earbuds. It’s nice to be able to run with just the watch and earbuds and not have to carry a phone for music.I was able to use my ANT heart rate strap and foot pod from 13 years ago with no issues. They sync quickly and stay synced. The onboard wrist heart rate and running dynamics functionality have been very good when I haven’t used my ANT accessories. So there is no need to get an HR strap, but if you have or want one, they work flawlessly.The Garmin ecosystem; the watch, Garmin Connect App, and the website are great. Highly customizable and reliable. I had most recently used Fitbit and found the experience with the app and its website to be headed in a negative direction this last year.Overall, I highly recommend this watch. If the price difference between this and the 265 is around $50, it’s a hard decision. It boils down to how you feel about AMOLED versus MIPS, and maybe the chance that 265 feature set continues to get updated a bit longer than the 255. When the price delta is above $50…. The 265 becomes hard to justify and the 255 is the obvious choice. To reiterate, training readiness isn’t worth much at all. It’s a combination of other metrics that are already on both watches. So the decision is simply AMOLED vs MIPS display versus price.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2024
reviews.product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: 46 MMStyle: MusicPattern Name: Smartwatch

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Slight overkill for the non-elites
reviews.author: Amazon Customer
reviews.content: Watch is top quality with a bunch of bells and whistles. I really only needed a watch to stop me from having to hold my phone on runs.All the extra features are nice to haves and have allowed me to look at my training from a professional outlook however I know where I am at. Combined with the strava app (or whatever app you want) it maintains tracking information well and accurate.Battery life is almost never ending, with a nice low profile appearance. I will classify this watch as perfect for its price point and as a "better to have it and not need it than need it and not have it" purchase.

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not bad Garmin watch
reviews.author: john
reviews.content: There is plenty you can say negative things about Garmin products but this watch is actually very fine. What's snowing about 'music' feature: this watch is not able to create playlist from uploaded songs, navigation has only forward button (you have to click to get into menu every time you want to go back), can't set autovolume (songs are played with different loudness), doesn't have option to block buttons on BT headphones. Does not feel like some premium sport smart watch - rather cheap plastic toy but it's light which is a +. It has nice feats like suggested workouts. Battery holds well (longer than Fenix 5), you can easily listen whole day to music (bt headphones will die first). Garmin pay is very limited what cards you can use it with. Live tracking works only when connected with phone.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2024
reviews.product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: 46 MMStyle: MusicPattern Name: Smartwatch

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best watch for a runner yet!
reviews.author: Speedy Gonzales
reviews.content: I've been running with garmin for over 10 years now and it keeps getting better. The updates from the garmin forerunner 245 are noticeable and the technology in this watch is outstanding. There are plenty of apps to connect the watch to, whether it's running to tennis it has a mode for it. The watch is light and responsive with every button pressed. The GPS signal is strong and accurate and the wrist HR is dead on. I'm going to be honest, I'll never get a garmin with out a music mode to it. It's super clutch to run around with Spotify Playlist loaded on my watch without my phone being needed. Additionally, if you do carry your phone while completing an activity and you happen to fall, there is an incident detection and will contact a designated person on your liat with accurate gps coordinates to you location.This watch is amazing and does everything you need it to do, and more !

The screen is nice and useful enough, but the new screen on the 165/265 is much brighter and nicer. Just not worth the extra money to me.RI would recommend this watch at the $250 or less price point.

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars The watch that finally replaced my Pebble
reviews.author: Amazon Customer
reviews.content: I'll probably go back to my trusty Pebble Time Steel from time to time (no pun intended... that time). You just can't beat that watch.Anyway, this one works well as a replacement, I guess. I'll always miss some things like the fun animations (which I'll never get on the Garmin), or the 2-week calendar on the watch face (which might be possible on the Garmin but I can't figure that out). I don't really need to know my blood oxygen level, or track my runs down to the second, or get a nightly sleep score and a daily morning report, but this watch does all those things.It doesn't look as nice as my pebble, but the screen is bigger. It also doesn't have a microphone, the most underrated feature. Actually, that would be Timeline.Anyway, I miss you, PTS, and don't lose hope. Maybe I'll have it in me some day to replace your battery. Please forgive me.

reviews.title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Difficult to use
reviews.author: M&M-L
reviews.content: Confusing interface, difficult to use. Hard to figure out a lot of the basic functions. Music can be transferred from your PC but you have to download a Garmin App onto your PC and, virtually none of your iTunes music will work because it's protected. I was only able to transfer 6 of my many hundred purchased iTunes songs. Audible books can't be transferred at all. Display is too small and too dim to read in most indoor settings. To use a map and to see the route you took, requires downloading a third party app - good luck figuring that one out. The best thing I can say is that the watch collects a lot of great data and stats which you can easily view on your phone. The battery life is the only reason I purchased this instead of an iWatch.

reviews.author: James
reviews.content: This is the Tech toy that is a for the workout addicted or the occasional user. I'm starting back on my exercise routine after a decade off. My old Polar and Moto watches no longer do what I want. This Garmin quickly finds GPS, tracks my movements, speed, pace, HR, Pulse Ox, HRV, and more things I just don't use every day. Still learning how to get the best out of it, but it seems to always have available what I want to try today. In normal operations I am getting 4 to 5 days of battery life. There is minimalist power saving mode that advertises about a month of power. My Moto was good for three hours, my Polar lasted a day, this is great.

reviews.title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Worked Great until it didn't
reviews.author: Baja Kids
reviews.content: I really loved this watch and switched from the Whoop band to the Forerunner 255 to avoid subscription fees and enjoy the additional features. I purchased the watch in March 2024 and also bought Asurion insurance. However, in August 2024, the watch stopped working while I was swimming in the ocean. It simply turned off, and when I managed to turn it back on, the screen displayed colored lines.Asurion couldn’t replace the watch because it was still under Garmin’s warranty, leaving me to deal with Garmin directly. I preferred Asurion’s service, as they would have provided a replacement within two days. Garmin’s process has been slow; I’m currently in my second week without a watch and expect to receive a replacement in another week. Being without my workout tracker for three weeks is unacceptable to me. I took good care of the watch, and it had no damage. I’m disappointed to have spent $400 on something that lasted only five months. I am giving it only one star as I see in the reviews this is common with these watched.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 23, 2024
reviews.product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: 46 MMStyle: MusicPattern Name: Smartwatch

reviews.content: No me agrado que al reloj no le dure la bateria los 12-14 dias que promete en un uso cotidiano... No lo use en modo deporte, ni gps, ni con musica... Simplemente lo tenia conectado al movil para tener las notificaciones... Lamentablemente se drenaba un 30% de la bateria de golpe, lo comprobé 3 veces cargandolo y usandolo de esta forma por 3 semanas más y me pasaba lo mismo... Debe ser que venía con alguna falla el reloj, sin embargo, pude devolverlo sin ningun problema... Sin dudas alguna volveria a comprar un Garmin fuera de este inconveniente, me encantó el sofware para deportes! (Dejando de lado el inconveniente con la bateria)
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2023
reviews.product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: 46 MMStyle: MusicPattern Name: Smartwatch

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars I didn't miss any features on my Garmin Forerunner 245
reviews.author: Emilio Jr Albarando
reviews.content: Perfect size. The main task on this watch is simply my running partner of at least 3 times a week for 15 miles or more.

reviews.product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: 46 MMStyle: MusicPattern Name: Smartwatch

reviews.title: 3.0 out of 5 stars update testing with garmin -This watch has some serious problems-
reviews.author: J. Ducroiset
reviews.content: I purchased the watch a about 2 months ago, I am having terrible battery life. I go to sleep watch at 75% wake up at 15%. I purchased the watch for the battery. Also it seems I have been doing a lot of stair climbing, the watch keeps giving me 10 flights sometimes before I get out of bed. I have heard other people who had this problem. I had a forerunner 245 for 3 years and never had these problems. The battery life is erratic, sometimes lasts sometimes dies. I would say I average maybe 5, 10 flights a day. I walk into my kitchen in the morning all on one level and the watch says 10 floors. It pisses me off I cannot see battery duration.Spoke with Garmin they added a log to my watch, I also took some third party apps off so far battery has been better, I will see it has been like this before.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2022
reviews.product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: 46 MMStyle: MusicPattern Name: Smartwatch

reviews.title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Problem with buttons
reviews.author: Harry
reviews.content: This was reported by other users online too. In my case it's the down button on the left. It gives you this two step click feel, really annoying. The other 4 buttons are smooth, so this is obviously a defect. Hope Garmin can improve the quality in the future. I can't tolerate it but I like the watch. So I'm getting a replacement and see if I get lucky.--- edit ---Got another watch this time it's the back button that has this strange click feel. I decided to keep the watch. Battery goes down about 5% every hour if you turn on GPS tracking. So 20 hours for a full charge. I don't use music because it's a battery drainer. Charging is quick. I didn't count exact time but it's around 30 minutes charge to full from 20%.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2022
reviews.product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: 46 MMStyle: MusicPattern Name: Smartwatch

reviews.content: This watch is wonderful. Great display. Awesome functions for workout and vital monitoring. And it's super comfortable with a long battery life. I charge it every 5-6 days. I'm very happy with this Garmin watch.

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Followup to review by Milesian
reviews.author: Xak
reviews.content: One important followup to the review by Milesian: The watch does NOT require the Garmin Express app in order to load music onto the device. You can set the watch to MTP (Media Transfer Protocol) mode by holding the UP button, select System, then USB Mode set to MTP. You can then connect to any computer with the included USB cable and then drag-and-drop MP3 files onto the device (this should work on any OS; I have tested on Windows and Linux, and it should also work on Mac).
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2022
reviews.product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: 46 MMStyle: MusicPattern Name: Smartwatch
